meta.content: Kyrene School District has some of the best elementary & middle schools in the Tempe, Chandler, & Phoenix area. Browse our website for more info!

a.title: Go to comments for Virtual District Art Showcase

img.alt: Kyrene Middle School student receives Courage Award from the City of Tempe

a.span: Kyrene Middle School student receives Courage Award from the City of Tempe

div.p: In March, Kaylee was recognized as part of Kyrene's Courage Awards for being an inspiring leader and positive role model in the face of adversity. We are proud to share that Kaylee was also recognized by the City of Tempe for the 2020 Tempe Youthfest and Courage Awards.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene Middle School student receives Courage Award from the City of Tempe

img.alt: Young student happy raising hands in class

a.span: Congratulations to Kyrene's Tempe Diablos Excellence in Education Award finalists

div.p: Congratulations to our Kyrene Excellence in Education Award finalists! For 30+ years, the Tempe Diablos have awarded educators and school staff for their dedication in enhancing learning, promoting positive school culture, and for leaving a lasting impact on students, colleagues and the community as a whole.

a.title: Go to comments for Congratulations to Kyrene's Tempe Diablos Excellence in Education Award finalists

div.p: February is Black History Month, and our Kyrene students are engaging in a variety of activities that promote their learning and understanding of the stories, struggles and accomplishments of those who contribute to our collective American story.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene celebrates Black History Month

a.span: Kyrene students share inventions at the 5th Grade Gifted Showcase

div.p: From biodegradable balloons to taco drones, students showed off their original inventions at the Kyrene School District Gifted Showcase. 5th grade students proudly displayed their projects and prototypes that outlined the conceptual process, creative design and final trials.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene students share inventions at the 5th Grade Gifted Showcase

a.span: Kyrene Honor Band, Orchestra and Choir perform at Honor Music Festival

div.p: On Thursday, Kyrene School District students, parents and community members gathered to celebrate a long-standing tradition that recognizes the importance of the performing arts.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene Honor Band, Orchestra and Choir perform at Honor Music Festival

img.alt: Spelling bee finalists with Dr. Vesely

div.p: The top spellers from around Kyrene School District competed last night at the annual District Spelling Bee. The 25 participants ranged from students in grades 4 to 8 and were the winners of their individual school spelling bees.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene School District Spelling Bee

img.alt: Aprende middle school students at the conference

a.span: Kyrene students attend Speak Up, Stand Up, Save a Life

div.p: Middle school students from Kyrene School District discovered what it means to be Difference Makers at the fourth annual Speak Up, Stand Up, Save a Life conference that took place earlier this week.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene students attend Speak Up, Stand Up, Save a Life

a.span: Kyrene educators earn National Board Certification

div.p: Two Kyrene educators were recognized in December, 2019 by Kyrene School District and Arizona K12 Center for earning National Board Certification (NBC).

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene educators earn National Board Certification

img.alt: Student picking toothpaste from hygiene bin

a.span: Kyrene's SSC collect and bag hygiene items for the FRC

div.p: The students who serve on the Kyrene Student/Superintendent Council (SSC) were tasked with coordinating a donation drive at their schools to support the Kyrene Family Resource Center (KFRC).

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene's SSC collect and bag hygiene items for the FRC

a.span: Nominations open for 2020 Tempe Diablos Excellence in Education Awards

div.p: Nominations are officially open for the 2020 Tempe Diablos Excellence in Education Awards!

a.title: Go to comments for Nominations open for 2020 Tempe Diablos Excellence in Education Awards

a.span: Kyrene students continue to grow and excel on AzMERIT

div.p: 2019 AzMERIT results are now available, and Kyrene School Districts results demonstrate the Districts ongoing commitment to ensuring all students learn, lead and achieve.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene students continue to grow and excel on AzMERIT

a.span: Kyrene de la Sierra named a 2019 National Blue Ribbon School

div.p: Kyrene de la Sierra, in the Kyrene School District, has just received the prestigious 2019 National Blue Ribbon Award from the United States Department of Education. Kyrene de la Sierra is among only five Arizona schools to receive this years coveted National Blue Ribbon recognition.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene de la Sierra named a 2019 National Blue Ribbon School

a.span: Seven Kyrene teachers receive grants from City of Tempe

div.p: Kyrene School District teachers are celebrating the award of seven grants from the City of Tempe to make everything from music to murals. Each year, Tempe awards grants up to $750. Seven Kyrene fine arts, performing arts and music teachers each qualified for the full amount.

a.title: Go to comments for Seven Kyrene teachers receive grants from City of Tempe

img.alt: Three Mariposa students smiling and using zSpace technology

a.span: Kyrene students learn with AR/VR technology aboard the zSpace Bus

div.p: Fifth graders at Kyrene de la Colina and Kyrene de la Mariposa hopped aboard the zSpace Bus this week for science lessons with a twist.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene students learn with AR/VR technology aboard the zSpace Bus

img.alt: Collin Kartchner speaking to students at Centennial Middle School

a.span: Kartchner brings "Save the Kids" presentation back to middle schools and community

div.p: Recap of Collin Kartchner's presentations to Kyrene middle school students and the community on the dangers of social media and screen-time.

a.title: Go to comments for Kartchner brings "Save the Kids" presentation back to middle schools and community

a.span: Positive Parenting Special Education Series at the District Office

div.p: Please join the Exceptional Student Services team for the upcoming information nights from 6:30 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. Kyrene District Office Board Room, 8700 S. Kyrene Rd.,Tempe, AZ 85284.

a.title: Go to comments for Positive Parenting Special Education Series at the District Office

div.p: Two Kyrene School District principals have just received the Maricopa County Exemplary Principal Award. Dr. Ana Gomez del Castillo, Principal of Kyrene de los Lagos Dual Language Academy, and Nancy Branch, Principal of Kyrene de la Mirada Leadership Academy, accepted the awards during surprise celebrations at their schools.

a.title: Go to comments for Leaders named exemplary principals

div.p: The Arizona Educational Foundation (AEF) announced the names of Arizona public schools receiving the coveted A+ School of Excellence award for the 2018-19 academic year on April 8, 2019.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene A+ Schools of Excellence

a.span: "Imagine the Possibilities" school approved by Board

div.p: The Kyrene School District Governing Board voted Tuesday, February 12, to approve the implementation of a program with two primary goals: Engage students in a dynamic learning environment that promotes academic excellence and prepares them to be innovators and leaders of tomorrow; and deploy educators in non-traditional ways by creating new roles and staffing structures which will attract and retain high-quality staff and reinvigorate the teaching profession.

a.title: Go to comments for "Imagine the Possibilities" school approved by Board

a.span: Governing Board action on budget proposals

div.p: The Kyrene School Governing Board voted on the proposals for 2019-20 budget reductions in all three focus areas at the Tuesday, January 22 board meeting.

a.title: Go to comments for Governing Board action on budget proposals

img.alt: Kyrene Teacher Nominated for MacGregor Teaching Award

a.span: Kyrene Teacher Nominated for MacGregor Teaching Award

div.p: Mr. Dave Carras, a teacher at Kyrene de la Mirada Leadership Academy in Chandler, was nominated for the Hannah E. (Liz) MacGregor Teacher of the Year History Teacher Award.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene Teacher Nominated for MacGregor Teaching Award

img.alt: Kyrene School District awards contract to support ongoing equity work

a.span: Kyrene School District awards contract to support ongoing equity work

div.p: As part of Kyrene School Districts commitment to ensure equity among all students, the District has announced the selection of Corwin Consulting to perform professional development and training on equity and diversity.

a.title: Go to comments for Kyrene School District awards contract to support ongoing equity work

img.alt: Spellers Compete for Title of 2019 Kyrene School District Spelling Bee Champion

a.span: Spellers Compete for Title of 2019 Kyrene School District Spelling Bee Champion

div.p: It was a packed house at the annual Kyrene School District Spelling Bee on Wednesday, January 23, 2019. All 25 Kyrene schools sent representatives to compete.

a.title: Go to comments for Spellers Compete for Title of 2019 Kyrene School District Spelling Bee Champion

div.p: Seventeen years after the tragic events of 9/11, we now live in a world where not a single one of our Ahwatukee school-age children can recall a time before that day. But a tradition among Kyrene schools ensures children learn to value and respect not only fallen heroes, but also those who still serve today, with special assemblies held on 9/11.

a.title: Go to comments for Students pay tribute to 9/11 heroes

div.p: Have you ever seen a child without a backpack? Or with shoes a size too small? Maybe youve heard of a family who lost their home to a fire, and you didnt know how to help. Our Kyrene students and families have needs far beyond the classroom, so we are reaching into our community to meet those needs, with a new tool called Purposity.

a.title: Go to comments for Connecting with kids in need

div.p: Once again, the Tempe Diablos are recognizing teachers and staff from the Kyrene School District, Tempe Elementary School District and Tempe Union High School District for inspiration, impact and achievement. Teachers and staff were nominated for the awards by students, families, peers, and principals.

a.title: Go to comments for Tempe Diablos honors staff

img.alt: Two schools receive civic award from ADE

a.span: Two schools receive civic award from ADE

div.p: Kyrene Traditional Academy and Kyrene de los Lagos Elementary have recognized as Arizona Excellence in Civic Engagement Merit School recipients by the Arizona Department of Education at the 5th Annual Civic Learning Conference.

a.title: Go to comments for Two schools receive civic award from ADE

img.alt: Choose Kyrene for your child's education

a.span: Choose Kyrene for your child's education

div.p: Schools emphasize high academic standards, invite strong parental involvement, and support a whole child approach to learning. The middle school framework is built upon academic excellence, responsive instruction, and student agency. Kyrene inspires students to develop a passion for learning, leading and achieving!

a.title: Go to comments for Choose Kyrene for your child's education

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Vision: All students achieve at their maximum potential to become problem-solvers, creators, and visionaries of tomorrow.

Mission: Kyrene School District will commit to student success for all, by providing engaging, challenging educational environments which promote and inspire passion for learning, leading, and achieving transformative life outcomes.
